H0.text: Crystals are the place where evidence of organisms that lived on Earth a long time ago would most likely be found.

H1.text: Lava is where evidence of organisms that lived on Earth a long time ago would most likely be found.

H2.text: Sedimentary rock is the location where evidence of organisms that lived on Earth a long time ago would most likely be found.

H3.text: Metamorphic rock would most likely contain evidence of organisms that lived on Earth a long time ago.

A4.text: Sedimentary rocks can contain fossils because, unlike most igneous and metamorphic rocks, they form at temperatures and pressures that do not destroy fossil remains.

A5.text: The chance of fossilisation is higher when the sedimentation rate is high (so that a carcass is quickly buried), in anoxic environments (where little bacterial activity occurs) or when the organism had a particularly hard skeleton.
